data.title: Excellent Coral Springs Indian Restaurant
data.text: Stopped in for lunch and had the samosas, mango lassi, chicken tika massala with rice and naan bread. Everything was excellent and very delicious. Great place for Indian food in Coral Springs. Service was very friendly and polite.

data.title: Best Indian Food in Broward!
data.text:
Khana Kh'zana had amazing food! I've eaten at countless Indian places in Broward County and this is by far the best! The prices are very low, too. I'm a vegetarian and most of the dishes I get are around $8-$9 (portions are big enough for 2 meals). I usually order two dishes for myself so I have lunch for the next few days.

It's morso a casual takeout place with 5-6 tables. Mel who runs the place is very friendly and is always will to answer any questions you may have about the menu.

data.title: Amazing Restaurant
data.text: I always come here. Very fast, food made to order,  customer service is great. Food is authentic. Everyone needs to stop in if there in the area, support the owner and this awesome restaurant he has created.  We live local so we're lucky to have them near by.

data.title: Authentic and Local -  An Amazing Combination
data.text: This is the best indian meal I have ever had.  What made it even better was that we are with local friends who in the case of one couple were from the region. And both understood how to order!  And what a wonderful variety we had!  Flavorful and powerful.

data.title: worth a try
data.text: did take out  on friday night to try somewhere different. our food was ok the chicken  tiki marsala was ok. not alot of meat however more sauce than meat. the naan bread was dry however. i would try the tandorri that was real good

data.title: Khana Kh'zana
data.text: Pleasant decor well kept restaurant, friendly staff thats very helpful. They explained the North India menu, I had tea and Chicken Korma.

data.title: Overrated!
data.text:
We made our decision to come here based on the high Trip Advisor ratings. We were quite disappointed. 

Dining room was cramped, not very well maintained. The food was disappointingly. Looks like to save on food cost, the chef skimped on meat in the two dishes we orders (lamb & chicken).

The service was friendly but very inattentive. 

Most likely I will not be back!

data.title: Do not be put off by the interior
data.text: The food is out of this world. It is in a small space in a strip mall, but make no mistake this place packs a punch with spice. I have never had a bad dish here. Made to order. If your lucky you can sit in one of the 4 seats inside.

data.title: Always great
data.text: We've been here many many times and each time we think is better than ever. It's all about the food here and we've never been disappointed. No better Indian food around.  Mal, the owner and waiter is always friendly, thorough and helpful. Can't Wait to go back.

data.title: Absolutely excellent!!!!!
data.text: Wow! Fabulous food that leaves one feeling satisfied for a very reasonable price. The Garlic Naan was amazing and I resisted the urge to eat nothing but that! I got the Samosa $2.95, delicious, flavorful and enough for a meal for me, a light eater, my husband got the Lamb Saag, wonderfully flavorful, and daughter had the Chicken Chanda, very uniquely flavorful! I only wish we lived closer, this would be a regular for us!

data.title: Amazing food
data.text: Came here with the family for dinner.  Very small done in area, but the food is amazing.   Recommend if you are looking for a quality meal at a low price.   Will visit again.

data.title: Always great food
data.text: Don't be put off by the appearance of the place, or the fact they serve on disposable plates. You can't eat those. But the food! The waiter asks how much spice you want, 1-10. I don't know how he does it, but he says he eats 20. 7 gets my nose running and my lips hot. Everthing we have had there has been wonderful, even the food we took home and ate the next day. Our go to Indian food place in this area.

data.title: Great taste and value for money
data.text: I have been couple of times. It's a great place. Taste and quality of food is good. Value for money. Great service.

data.title: Pure excelence
data.text: The place is small with just a few tables. The food takes all the credit. Their menu is not very vast, but anything you ask will blow your mind. The flavor is awesome. I am not very familiar with the Indian culture, but this seems to be pretty authentic. Also the server is very friendly. I've come a couple of times and will keep coming. I wish they opened something closer to the east.

data.title: The best Indian
data.text: The best Indian food hands down, once a week we get take out. Mine and my wife's favorite! Mel and team the best! Used to drive around to every Indian restaurant from palm beach to Miami, no more. Best spot for great Indian food!

data.title: Great Indian Food
data.text: Bought takeout here and totally enjoyed it.  Lamb, chicken and eggplant dishes were delicious.  Naan was perfect.  Prices were very reasonable.  Parking was a bit tight.

data.title: Take a trip to India and taste it all
data.text: This place is like traveling to India and going to a friends grandmother's house to eat a home cooked meal. The quaint environment and the sweet people who work there make this place so special not to mention the delicious food and generous helpings. Great for take out or dinning in. Highly recommend trying this little gem.

data.title: Great Food and Friendly People
data.text:
A small neighborhood restaurant.  It can be a tight squeeze for dining in, but the flavors are worth any inconvenience.  The staff are friendly and interesting, and will converse when not busy.

My now-adult children love it as well.  You can have as much or as little heat/spice as you wish.  The flavors are excellent and the value is good.

I have tried most of the items on the menu and have enjoyed everything.  I take my left-over sauce home and use it to make other meals later in the week -- great with baked chicken, other meats and fish.

Their meats and nans (traditional breads) are nicely done in the traditional oven.

We have visited often and have used it for a quick and reasonable meal.  I have also taken friends and business associates for lunch or dinner.

data.title: Tiny but packed full of flavor!
data.text: The place is small but the flavor is huge! Love how delicious the food is! Everything comes out on paper plates so if you want fancy, this is not the place for you. However if want delicious curry, butter chicken, naan bread etc.... try it!

data.title: Dirty!!
data.text: Went to this place the other day and was closed down by the health inspectors!!this place really needs to clean up
